snippet: Hundreds of cities across China are turning to deep-pocketed private investors to help foot the bill for public infrastructure and services.
abstract: Hundreds of deeply-indebted Chinese municipalities are trying to attract local and foreign investors to help pay for infrastructure and services; low-cost government loans from Beijing are drying up as officials fret over rising debt; trend is exemplified by city of Weifang in eastern China, which has had early success in attracting private capital.

byline.original: By NEIL GOUGH and CAO LI
byline.contributor: Neil Gough reported from Hong Kong, and Cao Li contributed research from Weifang, China.

lead_paragraph: Hundreds of cities across China are turning to deep-pocketed private investors to help foot the bill for public infrastructure and services.

headline.main: As China Reduces Local Spending, Cities Woo Private Investors
